summary: This document is an email chain between AIC Title Service employees and a federal prosecutor regarding a subpoena for information related to the aircraft N722JE. It shows the company's general counsel, Bruce Marshall, transmitting the subpoena response in multiple parts to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Bruce Marshall
persons.role: EVP & General Counsel at AIC Title Service
persons.context: He is the sender of multiple emails transmitting the subpoena response in parts to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Callie Meier
persons.role: Document Specialist at AIC Title Service
persons.context: She initially received the subpoena, completed the request for aircraft N722JE, and forwarded it to the general counsel for review.

persons.name: Suzanne Pruitt
persons.role: Recipient of emails (likely at U.S. Attorney's Office)
persons.context: She is copied on the email chain from Bruce Marshall regarding the subpoena response.

connections.description: Marshall is the EVP & General Counsel, and Meier is a Document Specialist at AIC Title Service; they are corresponding about a legal subpoena.
Marshall is sending a subpoena response to Pruitt, who is likely a federal prosecutor, indicating a formal legal correspondence relationship.

events.title: Callie Meier completes subpoena request
events.description: Callie Meier informs the U.S. Attorney's Office that she has completed the requested subpoena for aircraft N722JE and sent it to general counsel for review.

events.title: Bruce Marshall transmits subpoena response
events.description: Bruce Marshall sends the subpoena response in multiple email parts due to file size to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Subpoena issued to AIC Title
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sends a subpoena to AIC Title Service, discussed in a prior call, requesting information.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A subpoena was issued to AIC Title Service for information related to the aircraft with tail number N722JE.
The subpoena originated from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The response to the subpoena was transmitted by the company's general counsel, Bruce Marshall, in multiple parts on October 11, 2021.
The aircraft N722JE is associated with the Epstein case, as it is known to be one of Jeffrey Epstein's private jets.
The correspondence indicates an ongoing federal investigation requiring title information for Epstein's assets.
